alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 5:22AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall including urban and small stream flooding is expected through the morning commute. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 AM EDT, Showers with heavy rainfall rates could impact motorists traveling during the morning commute. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through early morning. This rain will result in minor flooding, primarily ponding on low lying roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The I 95 corridor between Portland and Augusta including surrounding communities of Lewiston, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Waterville and Bath.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
